page.title: 19MEDIA Newspaper reports (1)
page.content: Reports from the{"Sussex Express" published every Friday. {August 3rd 1984}- A car was stolen from outside the Blackboys Inn. {March 1st 1985}- A Blackboys farmer discovered a large metal-lined box, containing hair and bones, whilst digging on his land.It was the decomposing body of a dog with it's favourite rubber ball.A childless couple,Mr.and Mrs. Hills, had lived on the farm some 60 years ago. {March 22nd 1985}- Residents of Blackboys,Framfield and Palehouse Common voted unanimously at the annual parish meeting to set up a crime watch scheme. The parish council is to recruit 12 volunteers from within the parish. {May 24th 1985}- Lord Chelwood, former M.P. for Lewes, is opening his garden in aid of the Homeless in Sussex fund.
